basis: The user explicitly commits to the plan with clear, actionable steps and expresses intent to implement today, indicating a high likelihood of following the suggestion.
cognitive_dissonance: Conflicting signals: anxiety and fear around eating due to anorexia vs. deliberate plan to try eating and log progress. They seek control and coping strategies to reduce distress.
negative_thought_patterns: Anxiety-driven beliefs about meal intake; fear of losing control; potential all-or-nothing thinking; anticipatory worry about eating regularly.
emotional_triggers: Anorexia-related fear of intake; heat-induced discomfort; desire for predictability and control; anxiety about trying a new eating routine.
coaching_notes: Maintain clear, actionable steps and validate feelings. Encourage gradual exposure and consistent logging. Monitor for ED-related risks and coordinate with clinician support. Consider adding micro-goals and grounding techniques (e.g., box breathing) for anxiety management.
